name: Risk Profile
caption: Perform a standalone risk profile analysis
key_information:
This questionnaire will ask you contextual questions about a potential delivery. This is used to create a high level risk profile of a potential project or product. This technique can be used early in the planning to appropriate scope security resourcing and engagement

A risk profile is a useful tool for organisations that have large or long running delivery timelines and want to embrace increased planning and engagement.

The questions here are only some sample questions. You should customise these for your organisation if you wish to implement a Risk Profile process.

This questionnaire will not create any SDLT tasks and the submission will automatically be marked as approved

If you do not complete this questionnaire within 14 days, it will automatically expire

questions.title: Project Name
questions.heading: Please enter project name
questions.description: Please enter the name of the project or product you are deliverying

questions.title: Go-Live Date
questions.heading: Please enter expected go-live date
questions.description:
Please enter the date you expect this project to go-live.

If you do not have a definite date, please estimate one.

questions.title: Compliance Requirement
questions.heading: Is this project a compliance requirement?
questions.description: Is this project important to the successful delivery of a major compliance requirement for the organisation?

questions.title: Business Continuity
questions.heading: Would project failure impact the businesses ability to operate?
questions.description: Would project failure have significant implications for the continued success of the business?

questions.title: Customer Impact
questions.heading: Will this have a significant impact on customers?
questions.description:
Will this change have a significant impact on customers?

This can include any impact to the customer engagement or using our products. A significant change to the user interface or release of major new functionality should be marked as "Yes"

questions.title: Clear Requirements
questions.heading: Does the project have clear requirements?
questions.description:
Does the project have clear requirements that can be easily articulated and measured for success?

A clear requirement must be something that can be tangibly measured once achieved.
